resources.string: Reroute location requests to the OS
"Google’s location service is disabled. Tap “%1$s” to learn more. If you decide to keep it disabled, consider enabling “%2$s” option to improve app compatibility."
Revoke the Location permission from Play services.
Location access is off for all apps.
"Location requests are rerouted to the OS, but Play services still has the Location permission."
"Play services needs Location permission to be set to “%s”, and “Use precise location” needs to be enabled."

"Play services needs the “Wi-Fi control” permission to scan for Wi-Fi networks, which is used to estimate location. This permission can be allowed in Settings ⮕ Apps ⮕ Special app access ⮕ Wi-Fi control."
"Location service assisted by Bluetooth scanning requires the “Nearby devices” permission."
"When device is idle, push notifications will be delayed to improve battery life. To receive them quicker, set “Battery usage” to “Unrestricted” in Play services app info."
It\'s recommended to allow this. Tap to proceed.
To install this app, Play Store needs access to Android/obb folder
"Play services needs the “Nearby devices” permission to enable Exposure Notifications"
"Play services needs the “Nearby devices“ permission to enable Nearby Share"
%s needs to show a screen. Tap to allow
Play services needs the “Nearby devices” permission
"Push notifications will be delayed, because Play services app is not allowed to always run in the background. Tap to resolve."
This app needs the Speech Services component
"To sync contacts from a Google account, Play services needs the Contacts permission. Tap to open settings."

"Select which components of sandboxed Google Play are allowed to be updated to unknown versions by the Play Store.
Warning: Update to an unknown version may cause crashes and errors in sandboxed Google Play."
%1$s requires Play services to have the “Nearby devices” permission
Go to Settings ➔ Apps ➔ Sandboxed Google Play ➔ Android Auto
